ygData.subject: Re: Somethin seems wrong (long response)
ygData.msgSnippet: um, hate to tell you this pal, but your a moron than. Either that or you bought a Yugo, which would again put you in the moron category. You think that people
ygData.messageBody:
um, hate to tell you this pal, but your a moron than.
Either that or you bought a Yugo, which would again put you in the moron
category. You think that people don't pay for your failures? You think
that you don't pay for failures in real life? It's called R & D, and you
do pay for it, because they stuff you buy is a result of it, Hell, a CD
costs about hmm lets be nice and say $5 to make, that's material costs,
you pay a whole heck of a lot more than that (or else your an evil
little pirating troll) because your paying for the time it took to code
the software, which the programs expect to get paid for. Why? because
they learned, through schooling what works and what don't, or they
learned through trial and error on their own. Ok went to school, so no
you pay to learn from *other* peoples failures, not your own.
Sigh, what next people bitching because if my faction sucks in an area
that I charge more, but they pay much less for items?
/nos, He who wants to tattoo Moron on many people's foreheads so he
knows who *not* to deal with.


kurt walther wrote:
>
> From: kurt walther <itzkurt@...>
>
> Nick Emmerich wrote:
> >
> > From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>
> >
> > One thing everybody must learn, prices can ALWAYS go down and NEVER go up. Don't
> > take never literally, though. We need to raise prices on banded. 7 for gorgets,
> > 8 for bracers, 11 for masks, 13 for helmets, 12 for sleeves, 12 for mantle, 20
> > for mail, 20 for cloak, 12 for belt, 19 for leggings, 11 for boots. These prices
> > give us significant profit on 100% success and help even out the profits for
> > when we fail. If ALL of us sell at these prices and stick to them (don't let
> > them drop you more than a plat), then the 'low priced' banded sellers will be
> > very scarce indeed. Then you can see the 'wait an hour' frustration on the
> > buyers end. If someone auctions they are willing to pay 5 plat for a banded
> > bracer for over an hour, they'll be frustrated enough to give up and pay the
> > damn 8 plat. If we have a set price that majority follows, then we will still
> > sell. While the discount smith might sell 10 gorgets at 2 and a half plat profit
> > each, we'll sell at LEAST 5 gorgets in the same amount of time for 5 and a half
> > plat profit each. They might be making 25 plat, but we're making 27.5 and have
> > less chances for a failure :) If we group together and work as one group of
> > dedicated smiths, we can only win. If we become bitter enemies over who has the
> > lowest price, the price war will just destroy us all. We will ruin the value of
> > smithing. NO MORE DISCOUNTS!!! :)
> > -Rennin of E'Ci
> > Trade Council GM
> >
>
> I'm sorry.. are you a moron? Your plan won't work for shit. You keep
> your prices at what they are.. i will sell cheaper.. everyone will keep
> coming to me.. i'll get plenty of practice and my smithing will continue
> to raise.. and I'll make all the money while you sit all alone with your
> overpriced shit. People do NOT pay for failures. They pay for the
> product. As a smith, you are supposed to supply people with a product.
> You don't supply them with your failures. Smithing is a profitable
> business.. yes. But it's the greedy assholes like you who try to make
> other people pay for your lack of skill who ruin the trade. Pay for
> your own mistakes.
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
> ONElist: your connection to online communities.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
